content.raw: I would recommend against using shared pointers for `QWidgets` and instead use raw pointers which are closer to Qt's API and ownership model.
content.html: I would recommend against using shared pointers for QWidgets and instead use raw pointers which are closer to Qt's API and ownership model.

content.raw: Actually I think many of these object names are not being used and can be removed
content.html: Actually I think many of these object names are not being used and can be removed

content.html: Ditto about camelCase object name

content.raw: How about using camel case name for `ObjectName`, with the first character lowercase? We have other object name that match this approach.
content.html: How about using camel case name for ObjectName, with the first character lowercase? We have other object name that match this approach.

content.html: Set the other pointers to nullptr in this class?

content.html:
Missing \return.

Also, should this be a shared pointer? If not, can you make clear that this pointer should not be deleted.

content.html: What is the return value if _variableId is invalid?

content.html: Return true if the plot exists and was removed?

content.html: What is the return value for an invalid _plotId? Should the return value be an int, with -1 indicating an error?

content.raw: Can you add more documentation here? Include what this class is designed for, and how a person should (or should not) use it.
content.html: Can you add more documentation here? Include what this class is designed for, and how a person should (or should not) use it.

content.raw: Calling `plot->Plots()` is probably the same as calling `plot->findChildren<Canvas *>()`, but the latter returns a `QList`
content.html: Calling plot->Plots() is probably the same as calling plot->findChildren<Canvas *>(), but the latter returns a QList

content.raw: In the future, we could consider moving away from one plugin that supports many canvases to each plugin holding a single canvas and possibly having an "add canvas" button to spin up a new instance of the plugin. This would simplify the code and let ign-gui manage the canvases/plugins.
content.html: In the future, we could consider moving away from one plugin that supports many canvases to each plugin holding a single canvas and possibly having an "add canvas" button to spin up a new instance of the plugin. This would simplify the code and let ign-gui manage the canvases/plugins.

content.raw: This function doesn't need to be a member of `Canvas`, I think we could move it to `Helpers`
content.html: This function doesn't need to be a member of Canvas, I think we could move it to Helpers

content.raw:
On Gazebo, restart is triggered according to world control messages. Here, I didn't see any code path leading to it. 

Do you have an idea on how restart will be used in ign-gui?
content.html:
On Gazebo, restart is triggered according to world control messages. Here, I didn't see any code path leading to it.

content.raw: We can remove the palette and splitter, in ign-gui this is another plugin (`TopicViewer`)
content.html: We can remove the palette and splitter, in ign-gui this is another plugin (TopicViewer)

content.raw:
I think the wording on the manager needs to be changed since here we're not dealing with windows like Gazebo is. 

In fact, I think the whole `Manager` can be removed from ign-gui, since the concept of a singleton which manages various widgets seems conflicting with the plugin approach.
content.html:
I think the wording on the manager needs to be changed since here we're not dealing with windows like Gazebo is.

In fact, I think the whole Manager can be removed from ign-gui, since the concept of a singleton which manages various widgets seems conflicting with the plugin approach.
